7 
8 # 3rd Party Modules
9 import pygame
10 from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
11 
12 
13 class Asset(ABC):
14  @abstractmethod
15  def setPos(self):
16  pass
17 
18  @abstractmethod
19  def blit(self):
20  pass
21 
22 
23 class Image(Asset):
24  def __init__(self, width, length, img_path):
25  self.width = width
26  self.length = length
27  self.pos = (0, 0)
28  self.angle = 0
29 
30  self.init_img = pygame.image.load(img_path)
31  self.init_img = pygame.transform.scale(
32  self.init_img, (width, length))
33  self.img = self.init_img
34 
35  def setPos(self, x, y):
36  self.pos = (x, y)
37 
38  def setAngle(self, angle):
39  if angle < 0:
40  angle = 360. + angle
41 
42  self.img = pygame.transform.rotate(self.init_img, angle)
43 
44  def blit(self, screen):
45  rect = self.img.get_rect(center=self.pos)
46  screen.blit(self.img, rect)
47 
48 
49 class Rectangle(Asset):
50  def __init__(self, width, length, color):
51  self.color = color
52  self.rect = pygame.Rect(0, 0, width, length)
53 
54  def setPos(self, x, y):
55  self.pos = (x, y)
56  self.rect.center = self.pos
57 
58  def blit(self, screen):
59  pygame.draw.rect(screen, self.color, self.rect)
60 
61 class Lines(Asset):
62  def __init__(self, color):
63  self.color = color
64  self.points = []
65 
66  def resetPoints(self):
67  self.points = []
68 
69  def setPos(self, x, y):
70  self.points.append((x, y))
71 
72  def blit(self, screen):
73  if len(self.points) > 1:
74  pygame.draw.lines(screen, self.color, False, self.points)
75 
76 class Circle(Asset):
77  def __init__(self, color, radius):
78  self.color = color
79  self.radius = radius
80  self.pos = (0, 0)
81 
82  def setPos(self, x, y):
83  self.pos = (x, y)
84 
85  def setRadius(self, radius):
86  self.radius = radius
87 
88  def blit(self, screen):
89  pygame.draw.circle(screen, self.color, self.pos, self.radius, 5)
